definition: phonetic loan character/using one character interchangeably for phonetically related characters
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
fake/false/artificial/to borrow/if/suppose
see 假掰[gei1 bai1]
vacation
phonetic loan character/using one character interchangeably for phonetically related characters

sentences.english: Undertaking the collation research on " The Three Kingdoms ", interchangeable words are an inevitable obstacle.
sentences.chinese: 從事《三國志》的整理研究，通假字是繞不過的路障。

sentences.english: Variants in the sense of philology mainly refer to characters capable of replacing each other or variants of Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 作爲文字學意義上的異文，主要是指通假字和異體字。

definition: phonetic loan character/using one character interchangeably for phonetically related characters
loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
original form of a Chinese character
variant Chinese character
homophonic characters
sound and meaning
unison/homophone
original meaning/literal sense
sense (of a word)
synonym
structural particle, such as 的[de5], 地[de5], 得[de5] and 所[suo3]
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
Shuowen Jiezi, the original Han dynasty Chinese character dictionary with 10,516 entries, authored by Xu Shen 許慎|许慎[Xu3 Shen4] in 2nd century
character with two or more readings
component of a Chinese character (as the radical or the phonetic part)
see 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]
